It was a familiar background noise, one that I had grown used to over the months I'd lived here. But my friend's words were what really had my attention. She was saying something that I didn't want to hear, something that made me uncomfortable. I shifted in my seat, feeling the wooden chair creak beneath me, and tried to process what she was saying. It wasn't that I disagreed with her, exactly. It was just that I wasn't sure I was ready to hear it. Not yet, at least. I took a sip of my coffee, feeling the bitter taste on my tongue, and tried to gather my thoughts. I knew I needed to respond, to say something, but I wasn't sure what. My friend was watching me, her eyes narrowed slightly as she waited for me to react. I could feel her gaze on me, weighing me, and it made me feel even more uncertain. I set my cup down and leaned back in my chair, trying to buy myself some time. "I don't know," I said finally, the words feeling inadequate. "I just don't know."
